form.longName: PhenX PX550401 - Perceived Harm Of Substance Use
form.preferredDefinition: The National Survey on Drug Use and Health (NSDUH) provides information on the prevalence, patterns, and consequences of drug and alcohol use and abuse in the United States civilian noninstitutionalized population, ages 12 and older. These select NSDUH questions (11-item scale) probe a respondent's perception about the harm of smoking, taking illegal drugs, and consuming alcohol on four or five occasions. The four response categories range from no risk to great risk.

question.questionText: How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they smoke one or more packs of cigarettes per day? (harm_smoke_daily)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they smoke marijuana once a month? (harm_smoke_marijuana_monthly)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they smoke marijuana once or twice a week? (harm_marijuana_weekly)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they try LSD once or twice? (harm_lsd_once_or_twice)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they use LSD once or twice a week? (harm_lsd_weekly)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they try heroin once or twice? (harm_heroin_once_or_twice)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they use heroin once or twice a week? (harm_heroin_weekly)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they use cocaine once a month? (harm_cocaine_monthly)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they use cocaine once or twice a week? (harm_cocaine_weekly)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they have four or five drinks of an alcoholic beverage nearly every day? (harm_four_five_drinks_daily)
How much do people risk harming themselves physically and in other ways when they have five or more drinks of an alcoholic beverage once or twice a week? (harm_fiveormore_drinks_weekly)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The National Survey on Drug Use and Health (NSDUH) provides information on the prevalence, patterns, and consequences of drug and alcohol use and abuse in the United States civilian noninstitutionalized population, ages 12 and older. These select NSDUH questions (11-item scale) probe a respondent's perception about the harm of smoking, taking illegal drugs, and consuming alcohol on four or five occasions. The four response categories range from no risk to great risk.

form.longName: PhenX PX540601 - Sensitivity To Reward And Punishment Adolescent And Adult
form.preferredDefinition: The behavioral inhibition system (BIS)/behavioral activation system (BAS) scale is a self-administered 20-item questionnaire that measures individual differences in motivation. Respondents indicate how much they agree or disagree with the statements on a four-point scale (strongly agree to strongly disagree). Scores can be derived for three behavioral activation system subscales (Drive, Fun Seeking, and Reward Responsiveness) and one behavioral inhibition system subscale. This scale is based on the original BIS/BAS system, which was later revised by Gray and McNaughton (2000).

headerInstruction.text: Each item of this questionnaire is a statement with which a person may either agree or disagree. For each item, indicate how much you agree or disagree with what the item says. Please respond to all the items do not leave any blank. Choose onl..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Sensitivity to Reward and Punishment - Adolescent and Adult
module.preferredDefinition: Sensitivity to Reward and Punishment - Adolescent and Adult

question.questionText: 1. Even if something bad is about to happen to me, I rarely experience fear or nervousness. (rarely_experience_fear)
2. I go out of my way to get things I want. (get_things_i_want)
3. When I'm doing well at something, I love to keep at it. (doing_well_at_something)
4. I'm always willing to try something new if I think it will be fun. (willing_to_try_something_new)
5. When I get something I want, I feel excited and energized. (get_something_i_want_energized)
6. Criticism or scolding hurts me quite a bit. (criticism_or_scolding_hurts_me)
7. When I want something, I usually go allout to get it. (go_allout)
8. I will often do things for no other reason than that they might be fun. (do_because_might_be_fun)
9. If I see a chance to get something I want, I move on it right away. (move_on_it_right_away)
10. I feel pretty worried or upset when I think or know somebody is angry at me. (worried_when_somebody_is_angry)
11. When I see an opportunity for something I like, I get excited right away. (get_excited_right_away)
12. I often act on the spur of the moment. (act_spur_of_moment)
13. If I think something unpleasant is going to happen, I usually get pretty 'worked up'. (worked_up_over_unpleasant_things)
14. When good things happen to me, it affects me strongly. (good_things_affect_me_strongly)
15. I feel worried when I think I have done poorly at something important. (worried_when_done_poorly)
16. I crave excitement and new sensations. (crave_excitement)
17. When I go after something, I use a 'no holds barred' approach. (no_holds_barred_approach)
18. I have very few fears compared to my friends. (few_fears_compared_to_friends)
19. It would excite me to win a contest. (excite_me_to_win_contest)
20. I worry about making mistakes. (worry_about_making_mistakes)

Scoring: Items 1 and 18 are reversescored. Add up the scores associated with each answer response to obtain scores for the individual subscales listed below. *1= strongly agree *2= agree *3= disagree *4= strongly disagree *BAS Drive: 2, 7, 9, 17 *BAS Fun Seeking: 4, 8, 12, 16 *BAS Reward Responsiveness: 3, 5, 11, 14, 19 *BIS: 1, 6, 10, 13, 15, 18, 20 (scoring_540601)

protocol.longName: Sensitivity to Reward and Punishment - Adolescent and Adult
protocol.preferredDefinition: The behavioral inhibition system (BIS)/behavioral activation system (BAS) scale is a self-administered 20-item questionnaire that measures individual differences in motivation. Respondents indicate how much they agree or disagree with the statements on a four-point scale (strongly agree to strongly disagree). Scores can be derived for three behavioral activation system subscales (Drive, Fun Seeking, and Reward Responsiveness) and one behavioral inhibition system subscale. This scale is based on the original BIS/BAS system, which was later revised by Gray and McNaughton (2000).
